timeline.bodyText: That looks like the list is not useful, and it feels weird that if the exception has no cause it's not considered the root cause, since null will be returned.
timeline.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText: It should only return null if the exception is null, otherwise the list if never empty... However, we should handle the recursive cause structures as well. I'll fix it and add a test.
replies.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: I think @stuartwdouglas should look at this and the following methods and tell us if this is normal, or a bug.
timeline.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText: The templates are built at deployment time, the error page handler runs at runtime, which means we are in a different CL to the one that built the template.
replies.author: stuartwdouglas

timeline.bodyText: This is obviously useful, but I wonder if we should not put something more declarative in place, like ExceptionMapper<T> which JAX-RS has?
timeline.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText: I think that this could cause class loading issues...
replies.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: Can we put this in a template file? I strongly hate that in Quarkus core we have HTML in Java strings, but I understand why, no matter how mind-numbing frustrating this is. But in Qute this feels wrong, when this can be in a standalone Qute template file. Or is there a reason I'm not seeing?
timeline.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText: I wasn't sure where to put the template contents. We could extract it later...
replies.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: Doesn't this look like generally useful for pretty much anything HTML? Shouldn't we have something like Escaper.htmlBuilder() or Escaper.builder().forHtml()?
timeline.author: FroMage

replies.bodyText:
We have an optimized version of a result mapper in the runtime module: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/extensions/qute/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/qute/runtime/HtmlEscaper.java
Maybe we could replace the generic escaper with this one. I'll try to prepare a follow-up PR...
replies.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: Can you please sort the errors by increasing location? You example screenshot shows the last error shown first and it's confusing :)
